info.title: Ademico Peppol REST API
info.description:
# Introduction Ademico Peppol REST API helps you send and receive `Invoices`, `Credit Notes` and `Orders` in the Peppol Network. Ademico Peppol REST API is meant to be integrated in your ERP or in any other software application so that you can send and receive invoices automatically. Ademico Peppol REST API is not meant to be used by human users. > **INFO** Check our Peppol Tools > to validate your > `Invoices`, `Credit Notes` and `Orders`, lookup participants in the Peppol Network and in the Peppol Directory and > many more. # Environments Ademico Peppol REST API is accessible in two environments: - TEST - PROD ## TEST environment The TEST environment is used to perform tests with the Ademico Peppol REST API and integrate it with your ERP or software application. TEST environment is using the SMK, the Peppol TEST environment. It is not a problem to send invoices or other documents to other participants in the Peppol network in the TEST environment, they are not legally binding. The base URL paths for our TEST environment are different depending on if you are using OAuth2 or Basic Authentication: - OAuth2: `https://test-peppol-api.ademico-software.com` - Basic Authentication: `https://test-peppol-api1.ademico-software.com/domibus` Once you have finished your integration in TEST environment, you can move to the PROD environment. ## PROD environment PROD environment is used to send legally binding invoices/credit notes to your business partners. We recommend using the PROD environment after you have finished your tests in our TEST environment. The base URL paths for our PROD environment are: - OAuth2: `https://peppol-api.ademico-software.com` - Basic Authentication: `https://peppol-api1.ademico-software.com/domibus` # Authentication Ademico Peppol REST API supports the following types of authentication: - OAuth2 - Basic authentication ## OAuth2 We are using AWS Cognito as an Authorization Server and the OAuth2 client credentials flow. Please find below the token endpoints you need to use to get your JWT token in our environments: - TEST: `https://test-peppol-oauth2.ademico-software.com/oauth2/token` - PROD: `https://peppol-oauth2.ademico-software.com/oauth2/token` Here are the steps to authenticate using OAuth2: 1. Get a JWT access token - We will send you the `client_id` and `client_secret` - Call the token endpoint to get a JWT token using your `client_id` and `client_secret`. Your need to base64-encode your `client_id:client_secret` and pass the value in the `Authorization` header. Here is an example how you can get a JWT token in the TEST environment. For PROD environment you need to use the specific token endpoint URL mentioned above: ```shell curl -X POST -H 'Authorization: Basic YOUR_CLIENT_ID_AND_CLIENT_SECRET_BASE64' -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' 'https://test-peppol-oauth2.ademico-software.com/oauth2/token' -d 'grant_type=client_credentials' -d 'scope=peppol/document' ``` > **NOTE** The value `YOUR_CLIENT_ID_AND_CLIENT_SECRET_BASE64` used above is just an example. > **NOTE** A JWT token has an expiration time of one hour. 2. Call the Ademico Peppol REST API Once you have obtained a valid JWT token, you can call the Ademico Peppol REST API. You need to send in your HTTP request an `Authorization` header that contains the JWT token you have obtained in step 1. Here is an example how to call an endpoint using OAuth2: ```shell curl -X GET -H "Authorization: YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://test-peppol-api.ademico-software.com/api/peppol/v1/tools/connectivity" ``` > **NOTE** Pass your JWT token directly after the `Authorization` header. Do **not** add `Bearer` after > the `Authorization` header. ## Basic Authentication When using Basic Authentication, you need to send in your HTTP request an `Authorization` header that contains the word `Basic` word followed by a space and a base64-encoded string username:password. For example, to authenticate as user / mypassword you would need to send `Authorization: Basic YOUR_USERNAME_AND_PASSWORD_BASE64`. In the examples from the following chapters, you would need to replace `YOUR_USERNAME_AND_PASSWORD_BASE64` with your credentials in base64-encoded format. When using Basic Authentication, you need to use an access token `accessToken` as a query parameter in each request. > **NOTE** Contact us to send you the value of the `accessToken` which is specific to each environment TEST/PROD. Example of a curl request using Basic Authentication: ```shell curl -X GET -H "Authorization: Basic YOUR_USERNAME_AND_PASSWORD_BASE64" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://test-peppol-api1.ademico-software.com/domibus/api/peppol/v1/tools/connectivity?accessToken=ACCESS_T0KEN_YOU_RECEIVED_FROM_US" ``` # Errors When using the endpoints from our Ademico Peppol REST API you might encounter an error. In this case we will normally respond with status `400` unless documented otherwise in the specific resource method. Please see below and example: ```json { "code": "GENERIC_ERROR", "message": "Details of the occurred error" } ``` The error detail contains a `code` which identifies the error type and a `message` providing more information about the error occurred. You can find below the list of possible error codes and their meaning: | Code | Description | |------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | UNKNOWN_DOCUMENT_TYPE | You try to send a document and we could not recognize the document type | | DOCUMENT_NOT_FOUND | You refer to a document which does not exist in our system | | DUPLICATE_DOCUMENT | Occurs when you try to send a document which was already sent | | SUBMITTED_DOCUMENT_NOT_VALID | You try to send an invalid document eg wrong mime type, empty document, inconsistent values etc | | XML_VALIDATION_ERROR | You try to send a document which is not a valid XML document | | XSD_VALIDATION_ERROR | You try to send a document which is not valid against the XSD schema | | SCHEMATRON_VALIDATION_ERROR | You try to send a document which does not pass the Peppol Schematron business validation rules | | GENERIC_VALIDATION_ERROR | Any other error that might occur when you try to send a document | | SBDH_ERROR | An error occurred when we try to parse the SBDH envelope during sending/receiving flow | | PARTICIPANT_LOOKUP_ERROR | An error occurred while trying to look up a participant in the Peppol network(SML/SMP) | | PARTICIPANT_ERROR | Occurs when creating/updating/deleting a participant from Peppol network(SML/SMP) or Peppol Directory | | DOCUMENT_TRANSMISSION_ERROR | An error occurred while trying to send a document to the receiver party | | GENERIC_ERROR | Any other error not specified above | # Supported Peppol documents You can use the Ademico Peppol REST API to send and receive the following document types in the Peppol network: | Country | Document name | Identifier | Customization id | Profile id | urn:fdc:peppol.eu:poacc:bis:advanced_ordering:3 | Support for other document types will be added soon. # Document examples Here are some examples of documents that you can send and receive in the Peppol network: - Invoice - Credit Note - Order # Getting started In this chapter, we will guide you step by step to send and receive `Invoices` in the Peppol network TEST environment. Sending and receiving `Credit Notes` and `Orders` is similar. > **NOTE** Before continuing to the steps below, make sure you have already obtained from us the credentials to access > our API. ## Checking access to our API Before sending your first `Invoice`, you need to check that you have access to our Ademico Peppol REST API. In order to check that you have access, you need to execute a `GET` request against our [connectivity service](#tag/Connectivity) using the below curl command. If you get a status `200` it means that you have access, status `401` means that your authentication credentials are not correct. You need to adapt your credentials in the example below as described in the [Authentication](#section/Authentication) chapter. CURL commands (or use [Connectivity REST API](#tag/Connectivity)): OAuth2: ```shell curl -X GET -H "Authorization: YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://test-peppol-api.ademico-software.com/api/peppol/v1/tools/connectivity" ``` Basic Authentication: ```shell curl -X GET -H "Authorization: Basic YOUR_USERNAME_AND_PASSWORD_BASE64" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://test-peppol-api1.ademico-software.com/domibus/api/peppol/v1/tools/connectivity?accessToken=ACCESS_T0KEN_YOU_RECEIVED_FROM_US" ``` You can proceed to the next step after you have a successful connection. ## Register your legal entity as a participant in the Peppol network ### Introduction A legal entity is an organization/company that sends and receives documents eg invoices in the Peppol network. It is mandatory to [create your legal entity](#tag/Legal-Entity/operation/createLegalEntity) before sending or receiving documents in the Peppol network. After you create your legal entity you can send and receive invoices and other documents. Your organization will be also listed the Peppol Directory so that it can be discovered by other participants in the Peppol network. ### Register your legal entity You can register your organization as a participant in the Peppol network using the API [create legal entity](#tag/Legal-Entity/operation/createLegalEntity). Below you can find an example using Basic Authentication and OAuth2: Basic Authentication: ```shell curl -X POST "https://test-peppol-api1.ademico-software.com/domibus/api/peppol/v1/legal-entities?accessToken=ACCESS_T0KEN_YOU_RECEIVED_FROM_US" -H "Authorization: Basic YOUR_USERNAME_AND_PASSWORD_BASE64" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d @- << EOF { "legalEntityDetails": { "publishInPeppolDirectory": true, "name": "YOUR_COMPANY_NAME", "countryCode": "YOUR_COMPANY_COUNTRY_CODE", "geographicalInformation": "YOUR_COMPANY_STREET_AND_NUMBER, YOUR_COMPANY_CITY", "websiteURL": "YOUR_COMPANY_WEBSITE", "contacts": [ { "contactType": "YOUR_COMPANY_CONTACT_TYPE", "name": "YOUR_COMPANY_CONTACT_NAME", "phoneNumber": "YOUR_COMPANY_PHONE_NUMBER", "email": "YOUR_COMPANY_EMAIL" } ], "additionalInformation": "Our company is specialized in ..." }, "peppolRegistrations": [ { "peppolIdentifier": { "scheme": "YOUR_PEPPOL_PARTICIPANT_SCHEME", "identifier": "YOUR_PEPPOL_PARTICIPANT_IDENTIFIER" }, "supportedDocuments": [ "PEPPOL_BIS_BILLING_UBL_INVOICE_V3", "PEPPOL_BIS_BILLING_UBL_CREDIT_NOTE_V3", "PEPPOL_MESSAGE_LEVEL_RESPONSE_TRANSACTION_3_0", "PEPPOL_INVOICE_RESPONSE_TRANSACTION_3_0" ], "peppolRegistration": true } ] } EOF ``` OAuth2: ```shell curl -X POST "https://test-peppol-api.ademico-software.com/domibus/api/peppol/v1/legal-entities" -H "Authorization: YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d @- << EOF Same JSON as above EOF ``` If you get a status `200`, it means that you have successfully registered your legal entity as a participant in the Peppol network. You can now search your organization by company name in the Peppol Directory and it will appear in the search results. We will explain the 2 main sections from the register legal entity request from above: 1. `legalEntityDetails` This section contains the details of your organization which will be published in the Peppol Directory such as: - YOUR_COMPANY_NAME: The name of your company eg Ademico Software - YOUR_COMPANY_COUNTRY_CODE: The country in which the legal entity is registered eg BE - YOUR_COMPANY_STREET_AND_NUMBER, YOUR_COMPANY_CITY: The address of the legal entity eg 204 My Street, Leuven, Belgium - YOUR_COMPANY_WEBSITE: The company website eg https://ademico-software.com - YOUR_COMPANY_CONTACT_TYPE: The company contact type eg info, support - YOUR_COMPANY_CONTACT_NAME: The company contact name eg John Doe - YOUR_COMPANY_PHONE_NUMBER: The company phone number eg +32 123456 - YOUR_COMPANY_EMAIL: The email of your organization eg info@ademico-software.com Set the flag `publishInPeppolDirectory` to false if you don't want to publish your legal entity details in the Peppol Directory. In some countries, such as Singapore, it is mandatory to publish your legal entity details in Peppol Directory. 2. `peppolRegistrations` This section contains the identifier of your organization in the Peppol network(`peppolIdentifier`) and defines which documents your organization can send and receive(`supportedDocuments`). A legal entity can be registered in the Peppol network multiple times using different identifiers. For instance a legal entity in Belgium can be registered with the company registration number 0208:0552912569 and with the Belgium VAT number 9925:BE0552912569. Depending on the country in which your organization is registered you need to use a specific participant scheme and identifier in the section `peppolIdentifier`. You can have a look in the section [Participant scheme and identifier](#section/Glossary/Participant-scheme-and-identifier) for more details. The section `supportedDocuments` defines which documents your organization can send and receive. In the example above, the legal entity can send and receive the following documents: - Peppol BIS Billing UBL Invoice V3(`PEPPOL_BIS_BILLING_UBL_INVOICE_V3`) - Peppol BIS Billing UBL CreditNote V3(`PEPPOL_BIS_BILLING_UBL_CREDIT_NOTE_V3`) - BIS Invoice Response(`PEPPOL_INVOICE_RESPONSE_TRANSACTION_3_0`) - Peppol Message Level Response transaction 3.0(`PEPPOL_MESSAGE_LEVEL_RESPONSE_TRANSACTION_3_0`) You can have a look in the section [Supported Peppol documents](#section/Supported-Peppol-documents) for a full list of supported documents you can send or receive. By default, the legal entity is registered in the Peppol network(SML/SMP). Set the flag `peppolRegistration` to false if the legal entity was registered in the Peppol network (SML/SMP) using other methods than our API. In this case you will only be able to send documents but not to receive. You can use the API `Legal Entity Peppol Registration` to update your Peppol registration details. ## Sending Invoices After registering your legal entity as a participant in the Peppol network, you are now ready to send your first `Invoice`. You can download an invoice template from here and save it as `invoice-sending.xml`. Open the `invoice-sending.xml` file in a text editor and replace the following elements: - INVOICE_ID: The unique identifier of the `Invoice` - YOUR_PARTICIPANT_SCHEME: eg 0208 You can find in [Participant scheme and identifier](#section/Glossary/Participant-scheme-and-identifier) an explanation of participant scheme and participant identifier - YOUR_PARTICIPANT_IDENTIFIER: eg 0552912569 The other details from the invoice starting with YOUR_COMPANY_ are optional to fill in. You can follow a similar process for sending credit notes.You can download from here a template for a Credit Note. Send your invoice by executing the following curl command: CURL commands (or use [Invoice/Credit Note REST API](#tag/InvoiceCredit-Note/operation/submitFile)): Basic Authentication: ```shell curl -X POST -H "Authorization: Basic YOUR_USERNAME_AND_PASSWORD_BASE64" -F "file=@invoice-sending.xml" "https://test-peppol-api1.ademico-software.com/domibus/api/peppol/v1/invoices/ubl-submissions?accessToken=ACCESS_T0KEN_YOU_RECEIVED_FROM_US" ``` OAuth2: ```shell curl -X POST -H "Authorization: YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" -F "file=@invoice-sending.xml" "https://test-peppol-api.ademico-software.com/api/peppol/v1/invoices/ubl-submissions" ``` If you get a status `200` it means that you have successfully scheduled your first `Invoice` to be sent in the Peppol network. The `Invoice` is sent asynchronously, it is first put on a queue and it will be sent almost immediately. Now that you have successfully scheduled an `Invoice`, you need to know if it has been correctly received by the `Buyer` and if the `Buyer` has accepted or rejected it. You can receive updates when an `Invoice` status changes with the help of the `Invoice` notifications. In the section [Pull notifications(polling)](#section/Application-integration/Pull-Notifications-(Polling)) or [Push notifications(webhooks)](#section/Application-integration/Push-Notifications-(Webhooks)) you can get more details how to get notifications for sent `Invoices`. Here is sequence diagram which describes the flow of sending an `Invoice` using Pull Notifications: ![Sending Invoice with Pull Notifications](http://ademico-software.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/Peppol-sendInvoiceUsingPullNotifications.png) Here is sequence diagram which describes the flow of sending an `Invoice` using Push(webhook) Notifications: ![Sending Invoice with Push(webhook) Notifications](http://ademico-software.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/Peppol-sendInvoiceUsingPushNotifications.png) ## Receiving Invoices Before receiving `Invoices`, please make sure that you have [registered your legal entity](#section/Getting-started/Register-your-legal-entity-as-a-participant-in-the-Peppol-network) in the Peppol network. During the testing phase when you are integrating your ERP or software application with our API, it is useful to register a second participant so that you can send and receive invoices or credit notes between them. For instance, you [register](#section/Getting-started/Register-your-legal-entity-as-a-participant-in-the-Peppol-network) a legal entity as a Peppol participant with the identifier `9938:LU12345678` and a second participant with identifier `9938:LU12345678_part2`. Now in your UBL invoice you set the sending participant in the `AccountingSupplierParty`: ```xml LU12345678 .......................... ``` and the receiver of the invoice in the `AccountingCustomerParty`: ```xml LU12345678_part2 .......................... ``` Once you sent the above invoice, you need to call the [receiving notification endpoint](#tag/InvoiceCredit-Note-Notification/operation/getReceivingNotifications) to get the receiving notification. The receiving notification contains the `transmissionId` which you can use to [retrieve the UBL invoice](#tag/InvoiceCredit-Note/operation/getInvoiceInUBLFormat). See also in the next sections some examples how to get the receiving notification and how to retrieve the UBL invoice. When a `Seller` sends you as a `Buyer` an `Invoice`, we automatically validate the `Invoice` against the Peppol technical and business rules before informing you that you have received an `Invoice`. We perform the following checks: - XML validation - XSD validation - Schematron validation If one of the above validation is not passing, we inform automatically the `Seller` with the reasons of the failed validation. Technically we send an `MLR` message to the `Seller`. If the `Seller` does not support receiving an `MLR`, we send an `AS4 Signal` error.
In conclusion, the `Seller` is always informed if the `Invoice` validation is not passing and if you as a `Buyer` could not process the `Invoice`. If you receive a valid `Invoice`, you will be notified either via [Pull notifications(polling)](#section/Application-integration/Pull-Notifications-(Polling)) or [Push notifications(webhooks)](#section/Application-integration/Push-Notifications-(Webhooks)) and you get the transmission identifier (`transmissionId`) of the received `Invoice`.
With the help of the `transmissionId` you can now get the `Invoice` in UBL XML format: CURL commands (or use [Invoice/Credit Note REST API](#tag/InvoiceCredit-Note/operation/getInvoiceInUBLFormat)): Basic authentication: ```shell curl -X GET -H "Authorization: Basic YOUR_USERNAME_AND_PASSWORD_BASE64" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://test-peppol-api1.ademico-software.com/domibus/api/peppol/v1/invoices/{transmissionId}/ubl?accessToken=ACCESS_T0KEN_YOU_RECEIVED_FROM_US" ``` OAuth2: ```shell curl -X GET -H "Authorization: YOUR_JWT_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://test-peppol-api.ademico-software.com/api/peppol/v1/invoices/{transmissionId}/ubl" ``` Example of a received invoice: ```xml urn:cen.eu:en16931:2017#compliant#urn:fdc:peppol.eu:2017:poacc:billing:3.0 urn:fdc:peppol.eu:2017:poacc:billing:01:1.0 pbe000512-8 2022-05-19 2022-06-19 380 EUR 4025:123:4343 0150abc test-ademico-001 test-ademico-001 invoice1 dGhpcyBpcyB0aGUgcGRmIGludm9pY2UgYmFzZTY0IGVuY29kZWQ= 0552912569 0552912569 Ademico Software My street Kessel-Lo 3010 BE BE0552912569 VAT Ademico Software 0552912569 info@ademico-software.com 0123456712 0123456712 JohnDoe Simon Bolivarlaan Brussel 1000 BE BE0123456712 VAT JohnDoe 0123456712 john.doe@example.com 2017-11-01 9483759475923478 Delivery street 2 Building 56 Stockholm 21234 SE Delivery party Name 30 Snippet1 IBAN32423940 AccountName BIC324098 Payment within 10 days, 2% discount true Insurance 10 E 0 VAT 311.09 1481.4 311.09 S 21.0 VAT 30 0 E 0 VATEX-EU-F VAT 1501.4 1511.4 1822.49 10 1822.49 1 2 20 Consulting Fees test-ademico-001 TEST 0% TEST 0% 21382183120983 NO 09348023 E 0 VAT 10 2 12 1481.4 test-ademico-001 Description 2 TEST 21% 21382183120983 NO 09348023 S 21.0 VAT 123.45 ``` Here is sequence diagram which describes the flow of receiving an `Invoice` using Pull Notifications: ![Receiving Invoice with Pull Notifications](http://ademico-software.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/Peppol-receiveInvoiceUsingPullNotifications.png) Here is sequence diagram which describes the flow of receiving an `Invoice` using Push(webhook) Notifications: ![Receiving Invoice with Push(webhook) Notifications](http://ademico-software.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/Peppol-receiveInvoiceUsingPushNotifications.png) ### Receiving invoices via email In specific cases, it is useful to be notified by email each time you receive an `Invoice`. We will send you an email to your functional mailbox with the following content: - email subject: the invoice identifier - email body: invoice identifier, sender identifier(eg company registration number, VAT), sender name, sender country, receiver identifier(eg company registration number, VAT), receiver name, receiver country - 2 email attachments: - the UBL invoice in XML format - the invoice in PDF format Here is an example of the contents of the email body we will send you: ```html Document type: Invoice Document id: pbe000512-8 Sender id: 0208:0111111111 Sender name: Seller name Sender country: Belgium Receiver id: 0208:0222222222 Receiver name: Buyer name Receiver country: Belgium ``` After receiving the `Invoice` content in UBL XML format, you as a `Buyer` must process the `Invoice` in your ERP or software application. After the processing takes place, you can optionally inform the `Seller` about the status of the `Invoice` by sending an [Invoice Response](#tag/Invoice-Response/operation/sendInvoiceResponse)
For instance, you might decide to accept the `Invoice` or reject it because of a business reason eg invalid purchase order number. Please check the section [Invoice Response](#tag/Invoice-Response/operation/sendInvoiceResponse) for the possible values you can use to inform the `Seller` of your decision. # Application integration In this chapter, we will see how you can integrate your ERP or software application with the Ademico Peppol REST API and receive notifications either using [Pull notifications(polling)](#section/Application-integration/Pull-Notifications-(Polling)) or [Push notifications(webhooks)](#section/Application-integration/Push-Notifications-(Webhooks)) ## Generating your API client The Ademico Peppol REST API is documented using OpenAPI 3 specification. This means that you can easily generate the client in your preferred language. We will see below how to generate your client in Java using OpenAPI Generator. You can follow a similar approach for generating your client in other languages. First you need to download the OpenAPI Generator from here here and save it in a directory on your local machine. Then switch into that directory and execute the following command: ```shell java -jar openapi-generator-cli-6.1.0.jar generate -i https://ademico-software.com/peppol-rest-api/openapi.json -g java ``` OpenAPI Generator will generate a Maven/Gradle project with a following structure: ``` |- api |- docs |- gradle |- src |- README.md |- build.gradle |- build.sbt |- git_push.sh |- gradle.properties |- gradlew |- gradlew.bat |- pom.xml |- settings.gradle ``` In the directory `src/org/openapitools/client/api` you can find the client APIs eg `InvoiceCreditNoteApi.java` that you can use to call the server side REST service. In the directory `docs` you can find the API documentation with examples like the one below eg `InvoiceCreditNoteApi.md`. Here is an example how to use the client to get the Invoice UBL XML in the TEST environment: ```java // Import classes: import org.openapitools.client.ApiClient; import org.openapitools.client.ApiException; import org.openapitools.client.Configuration; import org.openapitools.client.auth.*; import org.openapitools.client.models.*; import org.openapitools.client.api.InvoiceCreditNoteApi; ApiClient defaultClient = Configuration.getDefaultApiClient(); defaultClient. setBasePath("https://test-peppol-api1.ademico-software.com" ); // Configure HTTP basic authorization: PeppolBasicAuth HttpBasicAuth PeppolBasicAuth = (HttpBasicAuth) defaultClient.getAuthentication("PeppolBasicAuth" ); PeppolBasicAuth. setUsername("YOUR USERNAME" ); PeppolBasicAuth. setPassword("YOUR PASSWORD" ); InvoiceCreditNoteApi apiInstance = new InvoiceCreditNoteApi(defaultClient); String transmissionId = "transmissionId_example"; // String | try{ String result = apiInstance.getInvoiceInUBLFormat(transmissionId); System.out. println(result); }catch( ApiException e){ // you must replace System.err.println and e.printStackTrace() with a logger from your logging library System.err. println("Exception when calling InvoiceCreditNoteApi#getInvoiceInUBLFormat" ); System.err. println("Status code: "+e.getCode()); System.err. println("Reason: "+e.getResponseBody()); System.err. println("Response headers: "+e.getResponseHeaders()); e. printStackTrace(); } ``` For more details on how to generate your API client you can check this article on our blog. ## Notifications overview When sending or receiving documents, `Invoices/Credit Notes` change their status depending on different events. The status change happens asynchronously and therefore this is the reason why notifications are needed. Example of situations when an `Invoice/Credit Note` changes its status: - the `Buyer` has validated, accepted or rejected your `Invoice/Credit Note` after you have sent it - you have received an `Invoice/Credit Note` from a `Seller`. We will see below how you can be notified when the status of your `Invoice/Credit Note` changes. ## Pull Notifications (Polling) When using pull notifications, you need to regularly poll the sending or receiving notifications endpoint to check if you have a pending notification. We recommend polling for notification once every minute or even longer. For instance, to check the status of an `Invoice/Credit Note` after sending it to the `Buyer`, you use [Notifications Endpoint](#tag/Notification/operation/getNotifications). Let's suppose you get the following sending notification which indicates that the `Buyer` has accepted your `Invoice`: ```json { "eventType": "INVOICE_RESPONSE_RECEIVED", "notificationId": 6, "transmissionId": "7ec22637303b11eda7239a0197b30fe2@ademico-software.com", "documentId": "pbe000512-4", "documentStatus": "ACCEPTED", "peppolDocumentType": "INVOICE", "sender": "0208:0552912569", "receiver": "0208:1999999943", "notificationDate": "2022-09-09T13:09:59.524", "invoiceResponse": { "invoiceTransmissionId": "7ec22637303b11eda7239a0197b30fe2@ademico-software.com", "responseCode": "AP", "note": null, "effectiveDate": "2022-05-22", "invoiceClarifications": [] }, "details": [] } ``` You need to process the notification and update the status of the `Invoice/Credit Note` in your ERP or software application. The next step is to consume the notification using the `notificationId` retrieved previously: CURL command (or use [Invoice/Credit Note Notifications](#tag/Invoice-Response/operation/consumeInvoiceResponseSendingNotification)): ```shell curl -X DELETE -H "Authorization: Basic YOUR_USERNAME_AND_PASSWORD_BASE64" -H "Content-Type: application/json" "https://test-peppol-api1.ademico-software.com/domibus/api/peppol/v1/invoices/sending-notifications/{notificationId}?accessToken=ACCESS_T0KEN_YOU_RECEIVED_FROM_US" ``` A consumed notification will not be retrieved anymore when getting the next time the notifications list. The other pull notifications types follow the same pattern explained above. ## Push Notifications (Webhooks) When you choose to be notified via push notifications (webhooks), we deliver the notification directly to your application. You would need to implement in your ERP or your software application our Webhook Services documented using OpenAPI 3 specification. Let's suppose that you as a `Seller` send an `Invoice` to the the `Buyer` who accepts your `Invoice`. We will push you the following notification by calling your webhook implementation described here: ```json { "eventType": "INVOICE_RESPONSE_RECEIVED", "notificationId": 6, "transmissionId": "7ec22637303b11eda7239a0197b30fe2@ademico-software.com", "documentId": "pbe000512-4", "documentStatus": "ACCEPTED", "peppolDocumentType": "INVOICE", "sender": "0208:0552912569", "receiver": "0208:1999999943", "notificationDate": "2022-09-09T13:09:59.524", "invoiceResponse": { "invoiceTransmissionId": "7ec22637303b11eda7239a0197b30fe2@ademico-software.com", "responseCode": "AP", "note": null, "effectiveDate": "2022-05-22", "invoiceClarifications": [] }, "details": [] } ``` We expect that you return status `200` which indicates us that you have successfully processed the webhook. In case you return a different status, we will retry sending for one six hours every 30 minutes. > **NOTE** Please make sure to you allow traffic from our servers in your firewall rules. We will provide you the static > IP we use > to call your service webhooks. You can refer to the [Notifications Endpoint](#tag/Notification/operation/getNotifications) documentation to see the types of notifications we can push to you. # Glossary ## Participant scheme and identifier The **participant scheme** and **participant identifier** together represent the unique identifier of a participant in the Peppol network. For instance the participant scheme and identifier of Ademico Software is `0208:0522912569`. The **participant scheme** describes the **participant identifier** type eg VAT number, Chamber of Commerce number, GLN number, etc. The participant scheme is usually specific to each country eg for Belgium is `0208` which is the enterprise number but you can also have an internationally used scheme eg GLN number. The complete list of Peppol participant schemes can be found on the Peppol website under section `Participant Identifier Schemes`. The **participant identifier** can be the participant's VAT number, Chamber of Commerce number, GLN, etc. For instance the participant number of Ademico Software is the enterprise number from the Belgian Crossroad Bank of Enterprises which is 0552912569. A legal entity can be registered in the Peppol network multiple times using different identifiers. For instance a legal entity in Belgium can be registered with the company registration number 0208:0552912569 and with the Belgium VAT number 9925:BE0552912569. Here are some examples of Peppol identifiers in different countries:
Country Peppol identifiers
Belgium
  • 0208:0552912569 where 0208 is the scheme for the company registration number and 0552912569 is the company registration number value
  • 9925:BE0552912569 where 9925 is the scheme for the Belgium VAT number and BE0552912569 is the VAT number value
Luxembourg
  • 9938:LU12345678 where 9938 is the scheme for the Luxembourg VAT number and LU12345678 is the VAT number value
Netherlands
  • 0106:12345678 where 0106 is the scheme for the Netherlands KvK number(Chamber of Commerce) and 12345678 is the KvK number value
  • 0190:00000001801999999943 where 0190 is the scheme for the Netherlands OIN(Governmental organization number) and 00000001801999999943 is the OIN value
  • 9944:nl001234567b01 where 9944 is the scheme for the Netherlands VAT number and nl001234567b01 is the VAT number value
Australia
  • 0151:12345678901 where 0151 is the scheme for the Australian Business Number and 12345678901 is the Australian Business Number value
New Zealand
  • 0088:1234567890012 where 0088 is the scheme for the GLN(Global Location Number) and 1234567890012 is the GLN value
Singapore
  • 0195:SGUEN123456789W where 0195 is the scheme for the Singapore UEN and SGUEN123456789W is the standard identification number of an entity
# Changelog - 1.9- October 2025 - Support for invoice and credit note Self-Billing - Belgian companies are now automatically de-registered from Hermes when you are trying to register them in Peppol - 1.8 - September 2025 - Support for Advanced Ordering: Advanced Order, Order Change, Order Cancellation, Advanced Order Response - Support for Singapore Order Balance - The legal entity geographical information and contacts are now optional when registering/updating a legal entity - 1.7 - March 2025 - New notifications endpoint which makes it easier to get notifications using one endpoint. - Singapore: - Possibility to perform KYC CorpPass process using API - Possibility to report documents to IRAS C5 - 1.6 - May 2024 - New Legal Entity API to better manage Peppol registrations; the Participant API is deprecated - Fix an issue when duplicate notifications were created in case the same invoice was submitted in parallel in the same time - Added support for PINT AU-NZ Invoices/Credit Notes used in Australia/New Zealand - Added support for Singapore PINT Invoices/Credit notes - Added support for Japan PINT Invoices/Credit notes - 1.5 - January 2024 - Removed the suffix "@ademico-software.com" from the transmission id - Reduced the time to wait after registering a participant - 1.4 - December 2023 - Added support for SI-UBL Invoices/Credit Notes used in Netherlands - Added support for OpenPeppol statistics - Possibility to filter on event type in the sending notifications - 1.3 - October 2023 - Possibility to send an email to specific email recipients when receiving a document eg Invoice/Credit Note/Order. The email contains the UBL XML and the attachments contained in the UBL XML eg the Invoice in PDF format - Support for Purchase Order - BIS Order only - 1.2 - July 2023 - Added support for Singapore Invoices/Credit Notes - Added possibility to filter the notifications(sending, receiving and invoice response) based on start date and end date - Possibility to send and receive Invoices/Credit Notes up to 50MB - Updated validation rules to the Peppol May release - 1.1 - March 2023 - Added possibility to filter the notifications(sending, receiving and invoice response) based on the sender and the receiver - Improved documentation

post.summary: Create a Peppol participant. Deprecated: use the Legal Entity API
post.description:
Create a Peppol participant and register it in the Peppol network. When using our REST API, it is mandatory to create a participant before sending or receiving a document in the Peppol network. To create a participant you would need to fill in the following data:
  • The participant scheme and identifier

    • The participant scheme list can be found here under section 'Participant Identifier Schemes'.The participant identifier must uniquely identify the participant eg VAT number

  • The list of supported documents the participant can receive.
  • The participant details that are published in the Peppol Directory
By default, your organization details are published in the Peppol network(SML/SMP) and in the Peppol Directory.
Set the flag `publishInSMP` to false if you don't want to publish the participant in the Peppol network(SML/SMP). You can set this flag to false when the participant is already registered in the Peppol network(SML/SMP).
Set the flag `publishInPeppolDirectory` to false if you don't want to publish the participant details in the Peppol Directory.

200.description: Participant created successfully. You get the database participant identifier as a response.

post.summary: Send an UBL invoice/credit note to the receiver
post.description: The invoice/credit note is scheduled in the queue to be sent to the receiver. The UBL is validated before is being sent.You get notified either via pull or push mechanism when the invoice/credit note has be received by the receiver. </br></br> For a standard invoice/credit note, the Seller sends the document to the Buyer. For a self-billing invoice or credit note, the Buyer sends the document to the Seller.

parameters.name: X-C5-REPORTING
parameters.description: If true, the API will report the submission to C5 after the document was sent to the receiver. Only used for Singapore.

file.description: The invoice or credit note in UBL XML format
The invoice or credit note in UBL XML format

400.description:
Error sending the UBL invoice/credit note to the receiver. In this case the UBL invoice/credit note is not sent to the receiver. Examples of cases when you get an error:
  • The submitted file does not contain an UBL invoice/credit note
  • The XML validation, XSD validation or Schematron validation fails.
  • Duplicate invoice/credit note: the invoice/credit note has been already sent
  • The receiver is not registered in the Peppol network or it doesn't support receiving the provided UBL invoice/credit note

post.summary: Send the Invoice Response back to the Seller
post.description:
Send the Invoice Response back to the Seller after we have received an invoice/credit note. The Invoice Response is scheduled in the queue to be sent to the Seller. You get notified either via pull or push mechanism when the Invoice Response has be received by the Seller.

An Invoice Response can be used to inform the Seller of the status of an invoice in the Buyer's approval and payment processes, based on the Buyer's business rules and/or a Seller/Buyer agreement.The following values can be used for the Invoice Response status codes:
CodeDescription
ABBuyer acknowledges: Status is used when Buyer has received a readable invoice message that can be understood and submitted for processing by the Buyer.
IPIn process: Status is used when the processing of the Invoice has started in Buyers system.
UQUnder query: Status is used when Buyer will not proceed to accept the Invoice without receiving additional information from the Seller.
CAConditionally accepted: Status is used when Buyer is accepting the Invoice under conditions stated in 'Status Reason' and proceed to pay accordingly unless disputed by Seller.
RERejected: MLR reject or Invoice reject. Status is used only when the Buyer will not process the referenced Invoice any further. Buyer is rejecting this invoice but not necessarily the commercial transaction. Although it can be used also for rejection for commercial reasons (invoice not corresponding to delivery).
APAccepted: Status is used only when the Buyer has given a final approval of the invoice and the next step is payment.
PDPaid: Fully paid or partially paid. When partially paid: Status is used together with Clarification Reason code PPD, only when the Buyer has initiated the payment of the invoice without having paid the accepted amount in full.

You can find here more details about the Invoice Response status codes

Depending on the status code, a clarification may be needed to state the Buyer's reason for the status and/or any expected action from the Seller's side. The clarification may be given either as text (in Status Reason) or as code (in StatusReasonCode). The purpose of the clarification is to provide the Seller with structured information which enables him to partially or fully automate his processing. The clarifications are of two types:

  • Reasons for the given status.
  • Actions that the Buyer requests from the Seller.

The following values can be used for the clarification code reason(when clarificationType=OPStatusReason):

CodeDescription
NONNo issue
REFReferences incorrect
LEGLegal information incorrect
RECReceiver unknown
QUAItem quality insufficient
DELDelivery proposed or provided is not acceptable
PRIPrices incorrect
QTYQuantity incorrect
ITMItems incorrect
PAYPayment terms incorrect
UNRNot recognized
FINFinance incorrect
PPDPartially Paid
OTHOther

The following values can be used for the clarification code reason(when clarificationType=OPStatusAction):

CodeDescription
NOANo action required
PINProvide information
NINIssue new invoice
CNFCredit fully
CNPCredit partially
CNACredit the amount
OTHOther

You can find here more details about the Invoice Response clarifications

400.description: Error sending the Invoice Response to the Seller

200.description: The Invoice Response has been scheduled in the queue to be sent to the Seller. You get notified either via pull or push mechanism when the Invoice Response has be received by the Seller.

message.message: The Schematron validation failed has failed for document [invoice.xml]

schematronValidationMessages.description: [BR-CO-15]-Invoice total amount with VAT (BT-112) = Invoice total amount without VAT (BT-109) + Invoice total VAT amount (BT-110).
schematronValidationMessages.schematronTest: every $Currency in cbc:DocumentCurrencyCode satisfies (count(cac:TaxTotal/xs:decimal(cbc:TaxAmount[@currencyID=$Currency])) eq 1) and (cac:LegalMonetaryTotal/xs:decimal(cbc:TaxInclusiveAmount) = round( (cac:LegalMonetaryTotal/xs:decimal(cbc:TaxExclusiveAmount) + cac:TaxTotal/xs:decimal(cbc:TaxAmount[@currencyID=$Currency])) * 10 * 10) div 100)

schematronValidationMessages.description: [BR-CO-14]-Invoice total VAT amount (BT-110) =  VAT category tax amount (BT-117).

get.summary: Deprecated: use the Notifications API api/peppol/v1/notifications. Get the list of notifications after sending an Order to the Seller
get.description:
You get notified when the status of an Order changes. The following Order status values are possible:
CodeDescription
QUEUEDWaiting to be sent to the Seller
SENTAcknowledged by the receiver Access Point C3
SEND_FAILEDFailed to send to the receiver's Access Point C3
REJECTEDMLR reject. Status is used only when the Seller will not process the referenced Order any further. Seller is rejecting this Order but not necessarily the commercial transaction. Although it can be used also for rejection for commercial reasons (Order not corresponding to delivery).

parameters.name: transmissionId
parameters.description: The transmission id of a sent Order to the Seller

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: The document id of a sent Order to the Seller

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: The sender of the notification

parameters.name: receiver
parameters.description: The receiver of the notification

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date of the period to filter the notifications. To filter all notifications for a specific day E.g. `2023-06-25` use `startDate=2023-06-25` and `endDate=2023-06-26`

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: The start date time of the period to filter the notifications. To filter all notifications for a specific time E.g. `2023-07-25T11:03:26.688Z` use `startDateTime=2023-07-25T11:03:26.688Z` and `endDateTime=2023-07-29T11:03:26.688Z`. `startDateTime` value has priority over `startDate`

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date of the period to filter the notifications

parameters.name: endDateTime
parameters.description: The end date time of the period to filter the notifications. `endDateTime` has priority over `endDate`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The starting page number from which we want to retrieve results. The first page is 0.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many results we retrieve per page

get.description:
The API creates notifications to inform you when a document was sent successfully or when you receive a document from other legal entities.

The following status values are possible when you, acting as a Seller, are sending an invoice/credit note to a Buyer. You will get notified via the notification `InvoiceSendingNotificationRO`:
CodeDescription
QUEUEDWaiting to be sent to the Buyer
SENTAcknowledged by the receiver Access Point C3
SEND_FAILEDFailed to send to the receiver's Access Point C3

The following status values are possible when you, acting as a Seller, have sent an invoice/credit note to the Access Point of the Buyer and it was received. You will get notified via the notification `MLRReceivingNotificationRO`:
CodeDescription
TECHNICAL_ACCEPTANCEDocument received and accepted by the Access Point of the Buyer, but it was not (yet) read by Buyer
REJECTEDMLR reject. Status is used when the Access Point of the Buyer will not process the referenced document any further due to validation errors.

When you, acting as a Buyer, are receiving an invoice/credit note from the Seller you will get notified via the notification `InvoiceReceivingNotificationRO`. This notification contains a unique identifier called `transmissionId` which you will use to get the incoming invoice/credit note using the endpoint Get Invoice/Credit Note.

The following status values are possible when you, acting as a Seller, are receiving an InvoiceResponse notification(IR) from the Buyer. Not all Buyers are sending an InvoiceResponse.You will get notified via the notification `InvoiceResponseReceivingNotificationRO`:
CodeDescription
BUYER_ACKNOWLEDGEStatus is used when Buyer has received a readable invoice message that can be understood and submitted for processing by the Buyer.
IN_PROCESSStatus is used when the processing of the Invoice has started in Buyers system.
UNDER_QUERYStatus is used when Buyer will not proceed to accept the Invoice without receiving additional information from the Seller.
CONDITIONALLY_ACCEPTEDStatus is used when Buyer is accepting the Invoice under conditions stated in 'Status Reason' and proceed to pay accordingly unless disputed by Seller.
REJECTEDInvoice reject. Status is used only when the Buyer will not process the referenced Invoice any further. Buyer is rejecting this invoice but not necessarily the commercial transaction. Although it can be used also for rejection for commercial reasons (invoice not corresponding to delivery).
ACCEPTEDStatus is used only when the Buyer has given a final approval of the invoice and the next step is payment
PARTIALLY_PAIDStatus is used together with Clarification Reason code PPD, only when the Buyer has initiated the payment of the invoice without having paid the accepted amount in full.
FULLY_PAIDStatus is used only when the Buyer has initiated the payment of the invoice.

Here is a list of all notifications defined in our OpenAPI specifications that you can receive:
NameEvent TypeDescription
InvoiceSendingNotificationRODOCUMENT_SENT
DOCUMENT_SEND_FAILED		Notification created when you, acting as a Seller, send an invoice/credit note to a Buyer. This notifies you whether the invoice was sent successfully or failed to be sent.
InvoiceReceivingNotificationRODOCUMENT_RECEIVEDNotification created when you, acting as a Buyer, receive an invoice/credit note from a Seller.
MLRReceivingNotificationROMLR_RECEIVEDNotification created when you, acting as a Seller, have sent an invoice/credit note to the Buyer's Access Point and it has been received. This notifies you whether the Buyer's Access Point has accepted or rejected the invoice for technical reasons.
InvoiceResponseSendingNotificationROINVOICE_RESPONSE_SENT
INVOICE_RESPONSE_SEND_FAILED		Notification created when you, acting as a Buyer, send an Invoice Response (IR) to a Seller. This notifies you whether the Invoice Response was sent successfully or failed to be sent.
InvoiceResponseReceivingNotificationROINVOICE_RESPONSE_RECEIVEDNotification created when you, acting as a Seller, receive an Invoice Response (IR) from a Buyer. This notifies you whether the invoice you sent to the Buyer was accepted, rejected, paid, etc.
OrderSendingNotificationRODOCUMENT_SENT
DOCUMENT_SEND_FAILED		Notification created when you, acting as a Buyer, send an order to a Seller. This notifies you whether the order was sent successfully or failed to be sent.
OrderReceivingNotificationRODOCUMENT_RECEIVEDNotification created when you, acting as a Seller, receive an order from a Buyer.
LegalEntityCorppassKycNotificationROLEGAL_ENTITY_KYC_CORPPASS_ACTIVATED
LEGAL_ENTITY_KYC_CORPPASS_ACTIVATION_ERROR		Specific to Singapore only: Notification created to inform you about the status of the legal entity KYC in Corppass.
LegalEntityCorppassC5NotificationROLEGAL_ENTITY_C5_ACTIVATED
LEGAL_ENTITY_C5_ACTIVATION_ERROR
LEGAL_ENTITY_C5_DEACTIVATED
LEGAL_ENTITY_C5_DEACTIVATION_ERROR		Specific to Singapore only: Notification created to inform you about the status of the legal entity C5 activation/deactivation in Corppass.
IrasSendingNotificationROIRAS_DOCUMENT_SENT
IRAS_DOCUMENT_SEND_FAILED		Specific to Singapore only: Notification created when you, acting as a Seller, send an invoice/credit note to a Buyer and you have indicated to our API to automatically report to IRAS via the HTTP header X-C5-REPORTING.

parameters.name: transmissionId
parameters.description: The transmission id of the notification

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: The document id of a document eg Invoice/Credit Note

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: The notification event type

parameters.name: peppolDocumentType
parameters.description: The document type: INVOICE, CREDIT_NOTE, ORDER

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: The sender of the notification

parameters.name: receiver
parameters.description: The receiver of the notification

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: The start date time of the period to filter the notifications. To filter all notifications for a specific time E.g. `2023-07-25T11:03:26.688Z` use `startDateTime=2023-07-25T11:03:26.688Z` and `endDateTime=2023-07-29T11:03:26.688Z

parameters.name: endDateTime
parameters.description: The end date time of the period to filter the notifications.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The starting page number from which we want to retrieve results. The first page is 0.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many results we retrieve per page

details.message: Error dispatching the message to http://receiver:8080/msh

/Invoice[1]/InvoiceLine[1]/Item[1]/ClassifiedTaxCategory[1]:[BR-S-05]-In an Invoice line (BG-25) where the Invoiced item VAT category code (BT-151) is "Standard rated" the Invoiced item VAT rate (BT-152) shall be greater than zero.

/Invoice[1]/LegalMonetaryTotal[1]:[BR-CO-13]-Invoice total amount without VAT (BT-109) =  Invoice line net amount (BT-131) - Sum of allowances on document level (BT-107) + Sum of charges on document level (BT-108).

/Invoice[1]/TaxTotal[1]/TaxSubtotal[1]/TaxCategory[1]:[BR-S-08]-For each different value of VAT category rate (BT-119) where the VAT category code (BT-118) is "Standard rated", the VAT category taxable amount (BT-116) in a VAT breakdown (BG-23) shall equal the sum of Invoice line net amounts (BT-131) plus the sum of document level charge amounts (BT-99) minus the sum of document level allowance amounts (BT-92) where the VAT category code (BT-151, BT-102, BT-95) is "Standard rated" and the VAT rate (BT-152, BT-103, BT-96) equals the VAT category rate (BT-119).
/Invoice[1]:[BR-CO-15]-Invoice total amount with VAT (BT-112) = Invoice total amount without VAT (BT-109) + Invoice total VAT amount (BT-110).

get.summary: Singapore - Get the details of the C5 activation
get.description:
The details of the C5 activation.
  • ACTIVATED= The C5 activation has been signed
  • INITIATED_ACTIVATION= Signing of a C5 activation has been initiated
  • INITIATED_DEACTIVATION= Signing of a deactivation of an existing C5 activation has been initiated
  • PENDING_KYC= C5 Activation has been initiated but participant is still waiting for KYC signing

parameters.name: legalEntityId
parameters.description: The id of the legal entity

parameters.name: peppolRegistrationId
parameters.description: The id of the Peppol registration for which you want to get the Corppass activation details

get.summary: Deprecated: use the Notifications API api/peppol/v1/notifications. Get the list of notifications after sending an Invoice/Credit Note to the Buyer
get.description:
Use only for sent Invoices/Credit Notes. You get notified when the status of an Invoice/Credit Note changes. The following invoice status values are possible:
CodeDescription
QUEUEDWaiting to be sent to the Buyer
SENTAcknowledged by the receiver Access Point C3
SEND_FAILEDFailed to send to the receiver's Access Point C3

parameters.name: transmissionId
parameters.description: The transmission id of a sent Invoice/Credit Note to the Buyer

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: The document id of a sent Invoice/Credit Note to the Buyer

parameters.name: eventType
parameters.description: The notification event type

parameters.name: peppolDocumentType
parameters.description: The document type: INVOICE or CREDIT_NOTE

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: The sender of the notification

parameters.name: receiver
parameters.description: The receiver of the notification

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date of the period to filter the notifications. To filter all notifications for a specific day E.g. `2023-06-25` use `startDate=2023-06-25` and `endDate=2023-06-26`

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: The start date time of the period to filter the notifications. To filter all notifications for a specific time E.g. `2023-07-25T11:03:26.688Z` use `startDateTime=2023-07-25T11:03:26.688Z` and `endDateTime=2023-07-29T11:03:26.688Z`. `startDateTime` value has priority over `startDate`

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date time of the period to filter the notifications

parameters.name: endDateTime
parameters.description: The end date time of the period to filter the notifications. `endDateTime` has priority over `endDate`

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The starting page number from which we want to retrieve results. The first page is 0.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many results we retrieve per page

details.message: Error dispatching the message to http://receiver:8080/msh
/Invoice[1]:[BR-CO-15]-Invoice total amount with VAT (BT-112) = Invoice total amount without VAT (BT-109) + Invoice total VAT amount (BT-110).

/Invoice[1]/TaxTotal[1]/TaxSubtotal[1]/TaxCategory[1]:[BR-S-08]-For each different value of VAT category rate (BT-119) where the VAT category code (BT-118) is "Standard rated", the VAT category taxable amount (BT-116) in a VAT breakdown (BG-23) shall equal the sum of Invoice line net amounts (BT-131) plus the sum of document level charge amounts (BT-99) minus the sum of document level allowance amounts (BT-92) where the VAT category code (BT-151, BT-102, BT-95) is "Standard rated" and the VAT rate (BT-152, BT-103, BT-96) equals the VAT category rate (BT-119).

/Invoice[1]/LegalMonetaryTotal[1]:[BR-CO-13]-Invoice total amount without VAT (BT-109) =  Invoice line net amount (BT-131) - Sum of allowances on document level (BT-107) + Sum of charges on document level (BT-108).

/Invoice[1]/InvoiceLine[1]/Item[1]/ClassifiedTaxCategory[1]:[BR-S-05]-In an Invoice line (BG-25) where the Invoiced item VAT category code (BT-151) is "Standard rated" the Invoiced item VAT rate (BT-152) shall be greater than zero.
